stream_context.summary: Kaze live-tests and designs the "Bowser Construction Site" (Course 11) mission of Return to Yoshi’s Island, debugging an N64-only crash, optimising ROM size, and building the comedic “mess with five workers” star, centred on a domino-style Womp tower and other interactive set-pieces. Zeina supplies new animations, while Badub resurfaces to compose a dedicated track.

development_findings.summary: A repeatable crash occurs only on real N64 hardware in the background-shaping function; Kaze locates the fault to an undefined F2 register value and plans a quick fix before retesting on console.
development_findings.quote: There is a crash in this function here on N64 only… Should be pretty easy to fix.

development_findings.summary: Lighting system reworked: the camera now acts as a light source with an adjustable brightness modifier to prevent overly dark scenes.
development_findings.quote: Basically I changed the way the lighting nodes work… I can just turn [brightness] up because I noticed the levels were being way too dark.

development_findings.summary: Mission design for Course 11: player must sabotage five Bowser workers (Womp tower, cement pit Koopa, lunch-break Goomba, glass-carrying Koopas, oil-barrel Koopas) to earn a star; emphasis on environmental storytelling over explicit markers.
development_findings.quote: Exclamation mark is basically telling. I want as many hints as possible… but not a single hint to be overbearing.

development_findings.summary: Womp tower concept: stacked, helmet-wearing Womps act as bricks; kicking one triggers a chain reaction with VFX, screams, and a splash when the tower collapses into water.
development_findings.quote: That is such a funny idea… you’re just going to kick them over and they’ll all fall.

development_findings.summary: Particle system and custom sound layering implemented for the Womp collapse (mist particles, layered ‘Domino’ sound, individual Womp grunts).
ROM size optimisation begun: all SM64 background images removed; 44 kHz samples to be down-sampled; large ambient SFX to be trimmed, aiming to save ~0.5 MB for streamed audio slots.
development_findings.quote: We’re at a point where we have to optimise the game for ROM size… we’re going to save like half a megabyte, which is very good.

development_findings.summary: Kaze prefers streamed WAV/MP3 for large areas to save RSP performance, making smaller ROM footprint critical.
Placeholder music in the level is AI-generated lo-fi; final score will replace it once Badub’s track is ready.
Multiplayer is planned as a toggleable option; considering extra playable characters (Mario, Luigi, Yoshi) but concerned about dialogue conflicts and asset workload.
Kaze rejects adding framed markers (e.g., exclamation icons) and instead layers multiple subtle hints, citing Missing Link’s library puzzle as design reference.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s design philosophy prioritises ‘cool platforming’ and layered environmental hints over raw difficulty or explicit instruction.
context_findings.quote: Difficulty… is not a thing you should strive for. Instead you should strive for having cool platforming.

context_findings.summary: He values authenticity: refuses to avoid political talk purely for branding, calling that approach ‘psychopathic’.
context_findings.quote: I realised… that would be such a psychopath thing to do.

context_findings.summary: Expresses confidence in his technical expertise: claims to know the N64 better than Nintendo and works professionally with Unreal Engine.
context_findings.quote: I definitely know a lot more about the N64 than Nintendo ever did… I’m literally a professional Unreal Engine developer.

context_findings.summary: Mentions local flooding and thunderstorms affecting stream but continues development, indicating work-life blend.

badub.summary: Composer returned after hiatus; spent a week and ~10 iterations on a track for Course 11 but is struggling to find a satisfying version; Kaze is excited about the commitment.
badub.quote: He said he’s been working on it for a week and had like 10 different tries and he just can’t figure out how to make it good, but he’s really putting in the effort.

zeina.summary: Zeina provides new animations for walking and tipping Womps plus Koopas; coordinates with Kaze on idle, fall-angle, and eye revisions live on stream.
zeina.quote: Right, we were working on the Womps next… Zeina’s working on it right now, so I cannot do that.

zeina.summary: She models a humorous ‘banana cat’ asset and adjusts Koopa eye textures based on feedback.

key_stories.title: Debugging the N64-Only Crash
key_stories.summary: A newly built level crashes on physical hardware but not in emulation. Kaze traces the fault to an undefined floating-point register in the background-shaping routine, planning a quick code patch before retesting.
key_stories.challenge: Level crashes with a floating-point exception on console.
key_stories.process: Examined MIPS register state, identified bad F2 load from colour table, reviewed V1 increments.
key_stories.outcome: Bug isolated; fix deferred until after design work.
key_stories.key_quote: There is a crash in this function here on N64 only… Should be pretty easy to fix.

key_stories.title: Birth of the Womp Tower
key_stories.summary: Unsure how to use Womps, Kaze and chat devise a domino-style tower of helmeted Womps that the player topples. Zeina supplies angled fall animations; Kaze adds particles and layered sounds.
key_stories.challenge: Make Womps serve a unique, humorous purpose in the construction level.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed uses (carrying beams, etc.), decided on stacked bricks, removed inner geometry, built chain-reaction code, added VFX and screams.
key_stories.outcome: Fully implemented interactive set-piece central to the first mission.
key_stories.key_quote: You’re just going to kick them over and they’re all going to fall.

key_stories.title: Composer’s Comeback
key_stories.summary: After a period of silence, Badub reconnects, eager to write the level’s theme. Despite creative blocks, he iterates repeatedly, boosting team morale.
key_stories.challenge: Need a bespoke soundtrack; composer had been inactive.
key_stories.process: Badub experiments with multiple drafts over a week, communicates struggles.
key_stories.outcome: Track not finished yet but renewed commitment encouraged.
key_stories.key_quote: He’s back and he’s making music again.

key_stories.title: Shrinking the ROM
key_stories.summary: With the cartridge nearing capacity, Kaze audits assets, finding large 44 kHz samples and unused SM64 backgrounds.
key_stories.challenge: ROM size threatens inclusion of streamed audio files.
key_stories.process: Removed legacy backgrounds; plans to down-sample/trim long SFX; targets ~0.5 MB savings.
key_stories.outcome: Action plan set; optimisation stage underway.
key_stories.key_quote: We’re at a point where we have to optimise the game for ROM size.

open_questions.topic: Final ROM size target and optimisation roadmap
